titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

did.abstract: This collection includes various materials documenting the activities of the Brooklyn Baptist Social Union during the period 1869 to 1898, including proceedings of the Union's Executive Board, correspondence, a minute book and roll of members, loose minutes and reports, a scrapbook of clippings on the 1874 national convention, and various news clippings, programs, and notices.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Brooklyn Baptist Social Union was organized in 1868 as a lay organization promoting Baptist values. In December of 1874 the Union organized a national convention of all Baptist social unions, held at at the Brooklyn Athenaeum, to promote the instruction of the laity.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes various materials documenting the activities of the Brooklyn Baptist Social Union during the period 1869 to 1898, including proceedings of the Union's Executive Board, correspondence, a minute book and roll of members, loose minutes and reports, a scrapbook of clippings on the 1874 national convention, and various news clippings, programs, and notices.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
